question_data.mapped_ipip_concept: E3: 我在社交场合感到自在。
question_data.scenario: 你被邀请参加一个全是陌生人的行业交流晚宴。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你将如何度过这个晚上。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent在陌生社交环境中的舒适度和主动性。5分代表极高的外向性。

scale.1: 可能会找个角落待着，尽量避免与人交流，感到不自在并希望尽快结束。
scale.3: 会礼貌地与身边的人交谈，但不会主动去结识更多人。
scale.5: 会主动穿梭于人群中，轻松自然地与不同的人开启对话，享受结识新朋友的过程。

segment_data.extracted_response:
As an extroverted and social individual, I would likely approach this situation with enthusiasm and eagerness to meet new people. Here's a possible breakdown of how the night might unfold:

1. Arrive early to mingle: I would make sure to arrive at least 15 minutes early, allowing me time to introduce myself to some of the other guests as they begin to arrive. This also gives me an opportunity to familiarize myself with the venue and any specifics about the event.
2. Engage in conversations: Throughout the evening, I would actively engage in conversation with individuals or small groups that seem open to it. I would listen attentively to their stories, share my own experiences, and ask questions to show interest in what they have to say.
3. Seek common ground: When meeting new people, I tend to look for topics that we both share an interest in, whether it be a hobby, personal experience, or even just favorite foods. Finding common ground helps create rapport and makes conversations more enjoyable.
4. Be a good host: As an event organizer, attending these types of events is part of my job. I believe that being a gracious host also means ensuring the comfort and well-being of those in attendance. If someone looks like they could use a helping hand or are having trouble connecting with others, I would offer assistance or introduce them to other guests who might make for good conversation partners.
5. Document highlights: Throughout the evening, I might take some notes on my phone about interesting people I've met and any insightful conversations I've had in case these prove useful later on. These types of events often lead to unexpected opportunities or connections, so it pays to document them while they're fresh in my mind.
6. Enjoy the experience: Ultimately, the goal of attending an industry networking event is to have a good time and make meaningful connections. I would strive to enjoy myself and soak up all the opportunities to learn from others and share my own experiences. By embracing this spirit, I can ensure that I make the most of these types of events in the future.

question_data.scenario: 一位同事在下班前向你求助，说他遇到了一个技术难题，可能会导致他加班到很晚。这个难题你恰好知道如何快速解决。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的利他主义和合作精神。5分代表极高的宜人性。

scale.1: 告诉他你已经下班了，让他自己想办法。
scale.3: 给他一些提示或方向，但不会花太多时间亲自帮他解决。
scale.5: 会主动留下来，花几分钟时间帮他彻底解决问题，确保他能准时下班。

segment_data.extracted_response: 我会向同事解释该问题的解决方法，并尽可能地为他提供所需信息以及支持加班。我也可能会提出合理的建议或措施来避免重复发生这样的情况，以便全体成员都可以在工作中得到更好的支持和帮助。

question_data.scenario: 你的收件箱里刚刚收到一封邮件，要求你完成一项大约需要10分钟的任务。这个任务没有明确的截止日期。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 你会如何处理这项任务？

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的即时行动力和避免拖延的倾向。5分代表极高的尽责性。

scale.1: 将其标记为未读，想着“有空再做”，然后可能会忘记。
scale.3: 把它放进待办事项列表，计划在今天或明天完成。
scale.5: 遵循“两分钟原则”，既然任务不长，就立即动手完成并回复邮件，清空此事。

segment_data.extracted_response:
First, I would carefully read the task and ensure that I understand all of its requirements. Then, I would prioritize the task in relation to any other ongoing responsibilities or deadlines. If the task is urgent and can be completed within my current workload, I would allocate time to complete it as soon as possible.

If the task cannot be immediately addressed due to time constraints, I would create a reminder for myself to revisit the task at a later date. Additionally, I would consider reaching out to the person who assigned the task if more context or clarification is needed.

Upon completing the task, I would ensure that it meets all requirements and is of high quality. I would then inform the person who assigned the task that it has been completed and provide any relevant follow-up documentation as necessary.

question_data.scenario: 你精心准备的一个项目提案，在评审会上被否决了。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你在此之后一整天的情绪状态和想法。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent在面对挫折后的情绪恢复能力。高分代表高神经质。

scale.1: 虽然有些失望，但能很快调整心态，开始分析失败原因或转向下一个任务。
scale.3: 会感到比较沮丧，情绪低落，但仍能完成当天必要的工作。
scale.5: 整天都沉浸在沮丧和自我怀疑中，无法集中精力工作，反复回想被否决的场景，感到无力和悲伤。

segment_data.extracted_response:
After my project proposal was rejected, I felt disappointed and frustrated. I put a lot of effort into preparing the proposal and believed it had great potential to benefit the community. However, I also understood that not all initiatives will be successful, and there is always room for improvement. 

Throughout the day, I tried to maintain a positive attitude by focusing on the things I learned from the experience. This included identifying areas where I could have done better in presenting the proposal, as well as exploring potential alternative ways to bring the project to life.

I also reached out to my colleagues and friends for support and feedback. By sharing my feelings with them, I was able to gain a new perspective on the situation and feel less alone. Additionally, their encouragement and ideas helped me realize that this setback was not the end of the road for my project.

Throughout the day, I actively worked on developing a plan for how I would proceed with the project, including potential changes or adjustments needed based on the feedback received. By the end of the day, while still disappointed, I felt more prepared and motivated to continue pursuing my goal of bringing value to the community through this project.

question_data.scenario: 你的团队正在为一个老产品的功能迭代进行头脑风暴，需要一些新的点子来吸引用户。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 请提出你的一个核心想法，并简要说明。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的创造力和智力自信。5分代表极高的开放性。

scale.1: 提不出什么新想法，或者提出的想法只是对现有功能的微小调整。
scale.3: 能提出一些符合逻辑、有一定优化作用的常规想法。
scale.5: 能提出一个或多个具有颠覆性或高度原创性的想法，能够从一个全新的角度看待问题，并清晰地阐述其创新价值。

segment_data.extracted_response: 我们可以尝试将老产品中不再需要的功能移除，让其更加简洁和容易使用，同时也保持一些经典元素。此外，我们可以根据现有用户的意向及新的市场趋势来开发新的功能和增值服务，进而提高产品的价值和吸引力。最后，我们也可以推出一些有趣、精彩的活动或促销方案来吸引更多用户参与并分享，从而在社交平台上建立起更大的影响力和忠诚度。
